record.title: Cellot, Louis (PARIS) imprimeur id007981
record.detail: active c. 1756-17??, life dates not certain. Son Louis-Marie enters trade in 1785 Confiscations notes: Louis Cellot, 1731-1815 is only Cellot in CERL to 1785; his son Louis-Marie (1760-1846) entered trade in 1786 and works in partnership with him 1786-88.. Initial 'L' appears in two of the three customs register entries related to Cellot.

record.title: Machuel, Pierre (ROUEN) libraire, négociant id002026
record.detail: STN archival note: dossier includes 1 'circulaire' 15/09/1783. After 25/09/1783 Jean Racine succeeded P. Machuel. MS1033, f.139 gives name as Pierre Machuet. Permission simple notes: Listed as bookseller in 1781 Almanach de la Librairie and Mellot et al. Traded at Rouen from c. 1744 to 1783, when he ceded his business to Jean Racine, who had been his business partner since 1781. This partnership is recorded as a separate entity from both Machuel and Racine, and also treated as such in the Permission Simple registers. Machuel's business address was Rue Ganterie. His father (died 1736) and older brother (died 1764) (both named Jean-Baptiste) were also booksellers. In 1752-3 and again in 1764, Machuel was embastilled for publishing banned books; active in the revolutionary municipality and Jacobin club. Born c.1722, died c. 1808). Non-specific references to Machuel, libr[aire] in the Permission Simple source data can safely be assumed to be references to refer to Pierre Machuel; those to 'Machuel, impr[imeur]' or 'impr-libr' to Etienne-Vincent.

record.title: Buisson, François M (PARIS) libraire id008376
record.detail: François Buisson was apprenticed to Joseph Cuchet in Grenoble 1766-1785 , but moved to Paris and entered the trade in effect 1782, though only admitted formally as a bookseller following brief apprenticeship to Cuchet's nephew Gaspard-Joseph 26 April-15 July 1785. (Not to be confused with Louis Buisson, who traded in Lyon at slightly earlier period and possibly in Paris in 1789-90: CERL). All but one of the entries relating to Buisson were signed for by Buisson, his younger brother (Buisson le jeune 'pour mon frère'), Pinchedez, the bookseller Dufour, or an overlapping combination of these persons, confirming that they were associated with the one business.

record.title: Chatelain, Zacharie [apparent false imprint] (AMSTERDAM) imprimeur, libraire, editeur id011099
record.detail: According to CERL, even in his own lifetime, (from 1720) the imprint of Zacharie (II) Chatelain was often employed as a false imprint by booksellers in Rouen, Paris and possibly Geneva, and this continued after his death in 1754 until around 1773. Chatelain's widow and son do not seem to have used that imprint.

record.title: Saury, Jean, Cours de philosophie, (n.p.: n.pl), in-unknown format 9 vol.
record.detail: Cours de philosophie de l'abbé Sauri

Attribution - several works from Saury were published in Paris from 1773, beginning with the 'Cours de philosophie. Élémens de métaphysique, ou Préservatif contre le matérialisme' in 2 volumes. Manuscript information gives '9 misc volumes, 1 maximes de bien penser, 1 pensées ingenieuse' suggesting this was a collection of Saury's works, although we cannot be sure of the exact composition of this collection.

record.title: Voltaire, Théâtre de Voltaire.. (Le), (Brouilhet [Broulhiet]: Toulouse, 1790), in-12 9 vol.
record.detail: Edition attribution not certain - began printing in 1790, perhaps under permission. This edition noted (apparently) by Dawson, who had a copy and thought it was not previously recorded. The edition runs to at least 9 vols, as revealed in Worldcat: Dawson only had access to vols 1, 2 and 4. For content of individual volumes see summary in Worldcat. Edition details: 'nouvelle édition, augmentée de plusieurs pièces, qui n'ont été imprimées que depuis la mort de l'auteur, & qui ne se trouvent que dans l'édition des oeuvres complettes, imprimées à Kell'.

record.title: Poinçot, Claude, père (VERSAILLES) libraire id002375
record.detail: STN dossier notes: The last two letters are signed Poinçot fils. Stock Sales Notes: Active at Versailles 1781-1785; Paris 1785-c. 1802. From 1790 in partnership with his son Claude-François. Drew up the list of books in the Bastille secret dépôt in 1790. Confiscations notes: Only Poincot in book trade at this period according to CERL. In partnership with son Claude-François Poincot from 1790.

Moreri, Louis, Grand Dictionnaire historique ou le mélange curieux de l’histoire sacrée et profane … le tout enrichi de remarques, de dissertations [et] de recherches curieuses ... tirees de differens Auteurs, [et] surtout du Dictionnaire critique de Mr. Bayle. (Le), (Jean Louis Brandmuller; veuve de Jean Christ: Basle, 1740), in-2 9 vol.
record.detail: Dictionnaire de Morery fo. edition de Basle

Worldcat records that this is the 'Seconde édition de Bâle en François, corrigée [et] considerablement augmentée.' Confiscation register states this was Basle folio edition. There was an earlier edition c. 1718. Appears to be 6 vols of main work (published all/mostly by Brandmuller) and three of supplement (published by the widow of Jean Christ. Edition attribution not certain: confiscation register gives only 'Dictionnaire de Morery, fo. edition de Basle'. Fullest edition title runs for many lines and appears to be: 'Le grand dictionnaire historique, ou, le mélange curieux de l'histoire sacrée et profane, qui contient en abrégé l'histoire fabuleuse des dieux & des héros de l'antiquité payenne, les vies et les actions remarquables des patriarches, des juges, des rois des juifs, des papes, des saints martyrs & confesseurs, des Pères de l'Eglise & des docteurs orthodoxes, des évêques, des cardinaux, & autres prélats célèbres, des hérésiarques & des schismatiques, avec leurs principaux dogmes, des empereurs, des rois, des princes, & des grands capitaines, des auteurs anciens & modernes, des philosophes, des inventeurs des arts, & de ceux qui se sont rendus recommandables en toute sorte de professions, par leur science, par leurs ouvrages, & par quelque action éclatante, l'établissement et le progrès des ordres religieux & militaires, & la vie de leurs fondateurs, les généalogies de plusieurs familles illustres de France, & d'autres pays, la description des empires, royaumes, républiques, provinces, villes, isles [i.e îles], montagnes, fleuves, & autres lieux considérables de l'ancienne & nouvelle géographie, où l'on remarque la situation, l'étendue et la qualité du pays, la religion, le gouvernement, les moeurs & les coutumes des peuples, où l'on voit les dignitez [i.e. dignités], les magistratures ou titres d'honneur, les religions & sectes des chrétiens, des juifs & des payens, les principaux noms des arts & des sciences, les actions publiques & solennelles, les jeux, les fêtes, &c., les édits & les loix [i.e lois], dont l'histoire est curieuse, &c., l'histoire des conciles généraux et particuliers, sous le nom des lieux où ils ont été tenus : le tout enrichi de remarques, de dissertations & de recherches curieuses, pour l'éclaircissement des difficultez [i.e. difficultés] de l'histoire, de la chronologie & de la géographie, tirées de différens [i.e. différents] auteurs, & surtout du Dictionnaire critique de Mr. Bayle.'
Jean Louis Brandmuller; veuve de Jean Christ

Grand Dictionnaire (le) historique ou le mélange curieux de l’histoire sacrée et profane … le tout enrichi de remarques, de dissertations [et] de recherches curieuses, pour l’eclaircissement des difficultez de l’histoire, de la chronologie [et] de la geographie, tirees de differens Auteurs, [et] surtout du Dictionnaire critique de Mr. Bayle

record.title: Belle, Coste (NIMES) imprimeur, libraire id007805
record.detail: Listed as Imprimeur-Libraire in Almanach de la Librairie, 1781. Mellot et al., say Belle operated at Nîmes from 1776, when he succeeded his mother as printer by decree of the royal council, to his death in 1794, following his death-sentence (4 April) for conspiracy. Publisher of Journal de Nîmes and Journal de Languedoc in the late 1780s. Member of a printers' dynasty - his mother (veuve Belle, active c.1774-6), father Antoine-Accurse (b. 1798, active 1728-c.1774) and grandfather Gabriel (to c. 1728) were also printer-booksellers; his brother Etienne worked in his father's workshop (from 1760).

record.title: Voltaire, Théatre de Voltaire, (n.p.: Lausanne, 1772), in-8 9 vol.
record.detail: Attribution: Worldcat records confirm existence of this 9 vol. Lausanne edition which is recorded as such in both STN records and Confiscation registers as a separate piece of merchandise. It appears to be the a separately issued edition of vols. 14-21 and 38 of the "Collection complette des oeuvres de Mr. de Voltaire" published at Lausanne by François Grasset. Title page reads 'Théâtre complet de Mr. de Voltaire'. The content is: Vol. 1: Oedipe ; Mariamne ; Brutus ; La mort de César. Vol. 2: Zayre ; Alzire ; Mérope ; Le fanatisme. Vol. 3: Sémiramis ; Oreste ; Les Pélopides ; Catalina ; Le Triumvirat. Vol. 4: L'orphelin de Chine ; Adélaïde du Guesclin ; Tancrède ; Les Scythes. Vol. 5: Olimpie ; Zulime ; Les Guèbres ; Sophonisbe. Vol. 6: L'enfant prodigue ; L'indiscret ; Nanine, ou l'homme sans préjugé ; L'Ecossaise, ou le caffé ; Socrate. Vol. 7: Le droit du seigneur ; La prude, ou l'homme au franc procédé ; Le dépositaire ; La femme qui a raison ; Vol. 8: Charlot, ou la comtesse de Givry ; La princesse de Navarre ; Le temple de la gloire ; Samson ; Pandore ; La vie de Molière ; Une critique du théâtre anglais. Vol. 9: Jules César / tragédie de Shakespeare, trad. de l'anglais. L'Héraclius espagnol, ou la comédie fameuse, dans cette vie tout est vérité et tout mensonge / de Calderon de la Barca, trad. de l'espagnol. Les loix de Minos ; Irène. This edition was not fully resolved in FBTEE-1 database of STN.

record.detail: Works announcing (usually newly) promulgated laws or edicts. (cf. ‘Legal codes’; ‘Legislation’). This keyword is a sub-category of ‘Law’.

record.title: Despotism k0261 Ideological tag
record.detail: Ideological term. Used for works treating and denouncing political despotism. NB. Not all works in this category carry the keyword ‘Politics’ – eg. those primarily concerned with the penal system.

record.title: Hymns k0468 Sub-category

record.title: Economics k0291 Top of tree

record.title: Official documents k0714 Stand alone term
record.detail: Texts produced by official bodies for a public or official purpose. The issuing body is usually described by a further keyword.

record.title: Financial administration k0339 Stand alone term
record.detail: Works treating the raising and use of state finances. Usually accompanied by the keywords ‘Politics’ and ‘Economics’.

record.title: Penal system k0757 Stand alone term
record.detail: Works treating the institutions and practices of legal punishment. Generally but not universally accompanied by the keyword ‘Law’.

record.title: International relations k0489 Sub-category

record.title: Monasticism k0660 Sub-category
record.detail: Non-fiction works dealing with monastic religious communities of either sex and any faith

record.title: Public Law k0843 Sub-category
record.detail: Works relating to the body of law that regulates relations between the individual and the state. This keyword is a sub-category of ‘Law’.

record.title: Local politics k0569 Sub-category
record.detail: Works concerned with the ‘Politics’ of a town or region within a larger state or entity.

record.title: Mythology k0676 Stand alone term

record.title: Political institutions k0797 Stand alone term

record.title: Origins of Religions k0720 Sub-category
record.detail: Works treating the theoretical or historical question of the Origins of Religion. Generally works with this keyword tend to be hostile to revealed religion. This keyword is a sub-category of ‘Religion’.

record.title: Political Rights k0798 Sub-category
record.detail: Works treating or advocating abstract or practical political rights for particular individuals or groups

record.title: Epistemology k0310 Sub-category

record.title: Religious Prophesy k0868 Sub-category

record.title: History k0447 Top of tree
record.detail: Works touching on the history of a society or societies or other defined unit. Contemporary events (defined as those of the reigns of Louis XV and Louis XVI in France are treated under ‘Politics’ + ‘Current Affairs’ not history). The exception is events in the recent past with full closure – eg. The Seven Years War. Usually history is qualified by one or more geographical tags and often also tagged to one or two or three rulers whose reigns spanned the period covered by the history. Note: histories of academic disciplines such as ‘History of Science’. ‘History of Medicine’ or ‘History of Education’ have not usually been tagged with the keyword ‘History’

record.title: Seguin, François M id007932
record.detail: An unknown Seguin, probably resident at Paris. Permission simple notes: No Seguin is listed at Paris in the 1781 Almanach de la Librairie or in Mellot et al. The two permissions granted to the purportedly Parisian bookseller Seguin on 28 August 1788 are therefore a little perplexing. The imprint probably associated with one of them, a 1790 edition the 'Lettres historiques et galantes de madame Du Noyer' confuses the situation further, since it reads 'Paris; et se trouvent a Avignon, chez François Seguin, 1790'. However François Seguin was a printer, and as based in the Papal enclave of and Avignon hence needed no permission. It seems likely therefore that a member of the family was established (however briefly) as a bookseller in Paris.
